titleStmt.title: Smoking Harran
SHAWI Corpus
titleStmt.funder: Funded by the FWF Austrian Science Fund under the number P 33574

publicationStmt.distributor: Austrian Center for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.

spanGrp.span: I don’t want it (viz. smoking) to continue like this all the time; I would like to stop (smoking). I saw the advantages of it (viz. non-smoking) when I quitted it.
The tobacco is poison, it is toxin, have you ever seen poison? Like poison, it makes that you don’t have taste in your mouth, that no taste is left in the mouth.
Your foot is aching, your body is aching, your head is dizzy, and this is all because of the tobacco. The one who stops smoking is at once free from all these calamities.
And then, after I had quitted it I started again because I saw it is hard for me. Everytime when I wanted to stop smoking, I sometimes did not smoke for one or two days.

Then I said, I want to smoke one or two cigarettes and I returned to it again. Not really, I smoked only a little bit, I didn’t want to smoke again; when my I fell upon it (I said) I don’t want to smoke it.

It’s poison! – If you succeed to quit you are lucky, you are free from it. – I stopped eight months ago, eight months. – Did you start again? – I have really returned to it. – So it is. – And I said, when I stop for one day only I will never return to it again. One single day, only one day.
Eight months. – Recently I bought a (smoking cessation) drug for 150 millions and I took it for one month but I could not quit it.

My brother, smoking. – I stopped eight months ago. For my whole life I had the same weight, even during the military service and so on. It never increased or decreased, (always) under sixty; sixty or under sixty. But during the eight months after stopping smoking I gained ten kilos of weight.
Formerly (was) never (like this); don’t say! Why do I not gain weight, I eat this and that, I eat meat, but it does not help, it’s for nothing.

However, after I have stopped smoking I gained ten kilos in less than eight months. – Have you lost them or do you still have them? – Actually I did not weigh myself but I think they are still here, they haven’t gone.
Your stomach is open for food, isn’t it? – Even your sleep gets better. – The one who quits smoking is (at that time) like a dry tree, there is nothing.
A tree, when a tree withers it has a disease. Either there is a worm in it or it has I don’t know what. Its leaves are bad; it does not grow and does not produce (fruit).

The one who stops smoking, like the (dried) tree starts to get branches again, it returns to life. – Returns to life. – Look, I have seen those who quitted smoking, even their colour changes – His colour, it changes it at once. –At his face the colour is changing.

It (smoking) treats your blood, your stomach is always full. The one who wants to quit smoking… isn’t there anything in your stomach? It’s always full and it does not become less. When it becomes a little bit less you want to eat and fill it but it’s always full (i.e. smokers do not eat a lot).
